intro: Trichocereus ingens, commonly known as the Amazonian torch cactus, is a species native to the Andean regions of South America. It is characterized by its tall, columnar stems that can grow up to several meters in height. The plant produces large, showy flowers that are typically white or pale pink, which bloom at night. It thrives in arid to semi-arid environments and requires well-draining soil. Due to its striking appearance and cultural significance, it is often cultivated by cactus enthusiasts.
